result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcellus Levon Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by November 12, 2015, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence. Huber privileges for work and CGIP program only: report date: May 15, 2015 by 5:00pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcellus Levon Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcellus Levon Jones in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS ORALLY AMENDED TO OBSTRUCTING AN OFFICER:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Marcellus Levon Jones in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing date.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marcellus Levon Jones in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Marcellus Levon Jones in custody and not produced. Defendant's appearance waived. Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Marcellus Levon Jones in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
